definition: term of office/CL:屆|届[jie4]/tenure (entire period in office)
surname Ren/Ren County 任縣|任县[Ren2 Xian4] in Hebei

to assign/to appoint/to take up a post/office/responsibility/to let/to allow/to give free rein to/no matter (how, what etc)/classifier for terms served in office, or for spouses, girlfriends etc (as in 前任男友)
a period of time/phase/stage/classifier for issues of a periodical, courses of study/time/term/period/to hope/Taiwan pr. [qi2]
presidential term of office/presidency

sentences.chinese: 那是他的第一個任期嗎？

sentences.english: Some cadres are eager to be in short-term gain perhaps gives inside lieutenancy .
sentences.chinese: 有的幹部急於在短期或者是任期內出成果。

sentences.english: The 54-year-old had promised during the campaign to serve out his term as mayor.
sentences.chinese: 當年54歲的朱立倫在競選中承諾將服滿市長任期。

sentences.english: Hancock died while serving his ninth term as governor.
sentences.chinese: 漢考克逝世在他的第九屆州長任期上。

sentences.english: The term of office is an important system for managing the heads of counties in Tang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 任期制是唐代對縣令進行管理的重要措施。

sentences.english: Article 169. An independent director may submit his resignation before the expiration of his term.
sentences.chinese: 第一百六十九條獨立董事在任期屆滿錢可以提出辭職。

sentences.english: The members of our highest court are granted life tenure.
sentences.chinese: 我們最高法院的成員都是終生任期的。

sentences.english: A two-year term was consistent with the Basic Law's legislative intent.
sentences.chinese: 兩年任期符合基本法的立法原意。

sentences.english: At the end of Jiang’s second term, Beijingand Taipei wereon a collision course.
sentences.chinese: 在江第二屆任期之末，北京與臺北劍拔弩張。

sentences.english: Mr Tung's five-year term ends in June 2000.
sentences.chinese: 董建華的五年任期將於二千年六月屆滿。

sentences.english: He remained popular throughout his tenure of the office of mayor.
sentences.chinese: 他在擔任市長的整個任期內都深得民心。

sentences.english: Following his term, Van Andel served as chairman of the board's executive committee.
sentences.chinese: 他的任期後，溫安洛擔任董事會執行委員會主席。

sentences.english: The chairman serves for four years and can be reappointed.
sentences.chinese: 董事會主席任期四年，可以連任。

sentences.english: Mr Jindal says he plans to serve out his full term as governor.
sentences.chinese: 金達爾表示他計劃滿任其作爲市長的任期。

sentences.english: A special election would be held to fill out Wu's term if he were to step down.
sentences.chinese: 阿將舉行特別選舉，以填補了吳的任期，如果他下臺。

sentences.english: In Nixon's tenure, the United States held three Soviet summit.
sentences.chinese: 在尼克松任期內，美蘇共舉行了三次首腦會晤。

definition: presidential term of office/presidency
to continue in (a political) office/to serve for another term of office
to leave office/to leave one's post
to leave office
to take office/to assume a post
period in office
to hold power/in office
president (of a country)/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4],名[ming2],屆|届[jie4]
to elect/election/CL:次[ci4],個|个[ge4]
to swear the oath of office
to come to power/to hold power/in office
the end of fixed period in office/expiration of a term
general election
presidential election
to take over (as minister, manager etc)
vice-president
